Company: DuPont
Description: Du Pont agreed to spend at least $66 million on air pollution controls at four sulfuric acid production plants in Louisiana, Virginia, Ohio and Kentucky and pay a civil penalty of $4.125 million under the Clean Air Act settlement.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Company: DuPont
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced that DuPont agreed to pay a penalty of $3.3 million to resolve 57 Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) violations, including allegations that it failed to immediately notify EPA of research indicating substantial risk found during testing chemicals for possible use as surface protection, masonry protection, water repellants, sealants and paints.

Company: DuPont
Description: On September 15, 2014, EPA filed a Consent Agreement and Final Order (CAFO) which simultaneously commences and resolves an administrative proceeding against E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Company (DuPont) for alleged violations of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).

Company: DuPont
Description: The Justice Department and the EPA reached a $1.5 million settlement with E.I. du Pont de Nemours related to a 1995 chemical release in eastern Kentucky that led to the evacuation of several communities surrounding the plant.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Company: DuPont
Description: EPA has reached three settlements with companies that produce and/or market pesticides, resolving EPA allegations that the companies or their agents distributed and sold pesticide products which lacked required labels or were missing critical information required by the EPA-approved labels, in violation of the federal law regulating pesticide use in the United States (the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide and Rodenticide Act, aka FIFRA).

Company: DuPont Corp
Description: The Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control, the US Environmental Protection Agency, and state and federal Departments of Justice have entered into a consent decree with the DuPont Corp. in which the company has agreed to pay a penalty of $500,000 for numerous violations of the DuPont Edge Moor plant site's National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit and other state and federal regulations.

Description: DuPont Dow Elastomers L.L.C. agreed to plead guilty and pay an $84 million criminal fine for participating in an international conspiracy to fix the prices of synthetic rubber which is used in a variety of products including tires, adhesives, coated fabrics, furniture, and shoes.

I. du Pont de Nemours and Co. agreed to provide $456,678 in back pay to 31 women as part of a settlement agreement with the U.S. Department of Labor, which had found that the women were unfairly denied employment in entry-level jobs at the company's Waynesboro, Va., manufacturing facility.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Company: E.I. DuPont de Nemours and Company
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recently settled with E.I. DuPont de Nemours and Company (DuPont) for the discharge of pollutants in violation of the Clean Water Act at its polymer fiber manufacturing facility in Kinston, N.C. Under the terms of the Consent Agreement and Final Order, DuPont paid a civil penalty of $59,000.

Company: E.I. DuPont de Nemours and Company
Description: E.I. DuPont de Nemours and Company, Inc., (DuPont) has agreed to pay a $15,600 civil penalty for failing to have proper written authorization for a Missouri agrichemical company to repackage and sell DuPont's Steadfast herbicide.

Description: DuPont agreed to pay $10 million to resolve its role in a pathbreaking lawsuit brought by Rhode Island against manufacturers of lead paint. A jury verdict against the other defendants, which could have resulted in billions of dollars in damages, was overturned by the Rhode Island Supreme Court in 2008.
Info Source: Rhode Island reaches $10 million settlement with DuPont, Associated Press, June 30, 2005 (via Nexis).

Description: DuPont agreed to pay $4.125 million to Louisiana, Ohio and Virginia as well as the federal government as part of the settlement of litigation concerning harmful emissions from sulphuric acid production plants. E.I. DuPont de Nemours and Co.
Description: DuPont agreed to pay costs of $211,734 to the United States and $2,348 to the Commonwealth of Virginia, and pay $42,069,916 for natural resource restoration projects in settlement of allegations it violated the Clean Water Act and the Virginia State Water Control Law at its Waynesboro facility by allowing mercury emissions to contaminate sediment, soil and wildlife downriver.

Company: E.I. Du Pont de Nemours & Co.
Description: DuPont agreed to pay $550,000 to Virginia as part of a $4.125 million settlement with the United States, Louisiana, Ohio and Virginia of litigation concerning harmful emissions from sulphuric acid production plants.

Agency: West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection

Company: DuPont de Nemours, Inc.
Description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company, The Chemours Company, DuPont de Nemours, Inc. and Corteva, Inc, agreed to pay a total of $50 million in settlement of allegations they damaged the natural resources of the state with historical releases of pollutants, including per- and polyfluoroalkyls.

Company: E.I. DUPONT DE NEMOURS AND COMPANY
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York

Company: DuPont de Nemours
Description: DuPont and its spinoffs Chemours and Corteva agreed to pay a total of $83 million to settle a group of cases alleging of dumping of the carcinogen perfluorooctanoate (PFOA) from a plant on the Ohio River in West Virginia. This addressed cases subsequent to those covered in a 2017 settlement in which DuPont and Chemours each paid $335 million.
Private Litigation Case Title: In re: E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company C-8 Personal Injury Litigation

Company: E. I. Du Pont De Nemours and Company
Description: DuPont and its spinoff Chemours each agreed to pay $335 million to settle allegations of dumping the carcinogen perfluorooctanoate (PFOA) from a plant on the Ohio River in West Virginia.
Private Litigation Case Title: Moody v. E. I. Du Pont De Nemours and Company

Company: E.I. duPont de Nemours and Company
Description: DuPont agreed to pay $8.3 million to settle a class action alleging that its operations in New Jersey caused perfluorooctanoate (PFOA) to enter the drinking water of nearby residents.
Private Litigation Case Title: Rowe et al v. E.I. Dupont de Nemours and Company

Company: E. I. DuPont
Description: As part of the resolution of a West Virginia class action concerning health and environmental problems linked to perfluorooctanoic acid (or PFOA), a chemical used in making Teflon, DuPont agreed to make cash payments, improve water facilities and fund a program for health monitoring of local residents, all at an estimated cost of at least $107.6 million.

Company: E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Company
Description: DuPont agreed to settle multi-district litigation alleging that its herbicide Imprelis caused damage to non-targeted vegetation. The settlement amount was not capped. At the time the settlement was approved, the company had already paid out over $377 million.
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Imprelis Herbicide Marketing, Sales Practices And Products Liability Litigation
